Class STVVoteCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • STVVoteCounter

  • public class STVVoteCounter
extends java.lang.Object

    STVVoteCounter

    STVVoteCounter - is a class that is responsible to actually implement the vote counting from an input file and determine winner candidate(s). The class object is responsible to load the candidates from the file, load the ballots from the file, assign every ballot to the correct candidate, determine winner(s) and resolve any tie if there. The tie condition is marked when more than 1 candidate has equal number of votes and the number of votes is actually highest among all the candidates. To resolve a tie, the vote counter drops the candidate who earned the last ballot in terms of order.
    Since:
    2018-03-13
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 8 (Saksham Goel - goelx029 | Kunal Munjal - munja004 | Abhishek Sairavi - saira005)

    • Field Detail

      • inputFileName

        private java.lang.String inputFileName
        Holds the name of the input file (relative path). This relative path points to the file from where all the information about the election would be extracted.

      • allCandidatesRunningInElection

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,STVCandidate> allCandidatesRunningInElection
        Holds the candidates that are engaged in the election. Enforces mapping from candidate ID to candidate objects for faster retrieval of information. This Hash Map holds information about all candidates that were ever involved in the election.

      • candidatesRunningInElection

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,STVCandidate> candidatesRunningInElection
        Holds the candidates that are engaged in the election. Enforces mapping from candidate ID to candidate objects for faster retrieval of information. This Hash Map is required to only contain information about the candidates which are still running in the elections (Not winner or dropped candidate).

      • numOfCandidatesRunningInElection

        private int numOfCandidatesRunningInElection
        Holds the total number of candidates that are running in the election. Is equal to the number of candidates loaded in the Hash Map - allCandidatesRunningInElection.

      • electionBallots

        private java.util.ArrayList<STVBallot> electionBallots
        Holds the information about all the ballots cast in the election.

      • numOfSeatsToBeFilled

        private int numOfSeatsToBeFilled
        Holds the number of seats that need to be filled in the election.

      • droopQuota

        private int droopQuota
        Holds the droop quota of the election.

      • winnerCandidates

        private java.util.ArrayList<STVCandidate> winnerCandidates
        Holds the information about all the winner candidates. Winner candidates include the top candidates required to fill all the seats. They are determined every time a candidate reaches the droop quota.

      • droppedCandidates

        private java.util.ArrayList<STVCandidate> droppedCandidates
        Holds the information about all the dropped candidates. Dropped candidates include the candidates dropped in each pass of the ballots. Dopeed candidates include candidates with least number of votes in each pass through ballots.

      • reportContent

        private java.lang.StringBuilder reportContent
        Holds the content that needs to be written as part of the report file for the election.

      • reportGenerateFlag

        private boolean reportGenerateFlag
        Holds the information about whether report content should be output into a file.

      • shuffleFeatureFlag

        private boolean shuffleFeatureFlag
        Holds the information about whether the user wants the shuffle feature to be On or Off!

    • Constructor Detail

      • STVVoteCounter

        public STVVoteCounter​(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                      int numOfSeatsToBeFilled,
                      boolean reportGenerateFlag,
                      boolean shuffleFeatureFlag)
        Creates a new STVVoteCounter object that is used in the main function to actually implement the voting.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - Name of the input file which contains the data about the election. This filename should be a relative path to the file.
        numOfSeatsToBeFilled - Number of winners required from the election.
        reportGenerateFlag - Describes whether the Vote Counter should output the content of the report into some file.
        shuffleFeatureFlag - Describe whether the Vote Counter should shuffle the ballots or not. Testing Feature is on when Shuffle feature is off.

      • STVVoteCounter

        public STVVoteCounter​(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                      int numOfSeatsToBeFilled)
        Overloading the constructor to marks the report generate flag and shuffle feature flag have default values.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName - Name of the input file which contains the data about the election. This filename should be a relative path to the file.
        numOfSeatsToBeFilled - Number of winners required from the election.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllCandidatesRunningInElection

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,STVCandidate> getAllCandidatesRunningInElection​()
        Returns the Hash Map of all the candidates involved in the election.
        Returns:
        HashMap{Long, STVCandidate} - Hash Map that contains all the candidates that were ever involved in the election.

      • loadCandidatesFromInputFile

        private void loadCandidatesFromInputFile​()
        Loads the information about each and every candidate running in the election. This function populates the hash map of candidates. This hash map member variable maps IDs of candidates to their respective objects.

      • addCandidateIDsInOrderOfPreference

        private void addCandidateIDsInOrderOfPreference​(STVBallot newBallot,
                                                java.lang.String[] ballotArray)
        Loads the candidate id's in order of their preferences (input from ballotArray) to the ballot object.
        Parameters:
        ballotArray - String array of the input line from file separated by ",". Each index contains either spaces (denoting no choice made) or empty string or some number denoting the preference of the corresponding candidate.
        newBallot - Ballot object that needs to be loaded with Candidate IDs in order of their preference

      • loadBallotsFromInputFIle

        private void loadBallotsFromInputFIle​()
        Loads all the ballots cast in the election (input file) into a list of ballots. Helps in storing the information about all the electionBallots. The vote counter iterates through these ballots and aggregates their votes into corresponding candidates.

      • setDroopQuota

        private void setDroopQuota​()
        Sets the droop quota for the election. Uses the predefined formula as stated in the writeup to set the droopQuota of a particular election.

      • setBallotOrderNumbersAfterShuffling

        private void setBallotOrderNumbersAfterShuffling​()
        Modifies the order number of all the ballots to some new order number which is representative of how the ballots would be extracted from the list of ballots after they have been shuffled.

      • resetBallotsAssignedToCandidate

        private void resetBallotsAssignedToCandidate​()
        Reset all the ballots associated with all the candidates running in election. This is done again and again to redistribute the ballots still left in the election. This function generally clears the ballots of the candidates remaining in the election after a pass through all the ballots. These candidates denote those candidates who have not been declared as a winner or dropped and this will be participating in another pass through the ballots.

      • getCandidate

        private STVCandidate getCandidate​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> candidateIDList)
        Returns the first available candidate (status undeclared - not winner or dropped) in the voting based on the preferences marked by ballot.
        Parameters:
        candidateIDList - The list of Candidate IDs in order of preference. This list is taken from the ballot.
        Returns:
        STVCandidate - Returns the first available candidate which matches the candidate ID in the list.

      • redistributeDroppedCandidatesVotes

        private void redistributeDroppedCandidatesVotes​(STVCandidate droppedCandidate)
        Redistribute the ballots of the dropped candidate. Because the candidate to which the ballots belong to have been dropped they are no longer running in the election and thus this function takes advantage of this fact and distributes the ballot vote to next available candidate.
        Parameters:
        droppedCandidate - Candidate dropped most recently from the election.

      • declareWinner

        private void declareWinner​(STVCandidate winnerCandidate)
        Add the candidate to the winners list and remove them from the election, Remove from Hash Map of candidatesRunningInElection.
        Parameters:
        winnerCandidate - Winner candidate of a particular pass through ballots.

      • distributeBallots

        private void distributeBallots​()
        Distributes all the active election ballots to appropriate candidates which are still running in election. Active election ballots are all those ballots that have not been credited. These ballots generally belong to the candidates not declared winner.

      • dropCandidateFromElection

        private void dropCandidateFromElection​()
        Drops a candidate in the election after one pass through all the election ballots. Is also responsible to check whether there is a tie and call appropriate methods to resolve that.

      • resolveElectionTie

        private void resolveElectionTie​(java.util.List<STVCandidate> tieCandidateList)
        Resolve a tie among the candidates that need to be dropped from the election. A tie condition holds when multiple candidates have the same number of votes and the number of votes they have is the least among all candidates. To resolve the tie first find the candidate which received the last vote in order of parsing through the election ballots. The candidate with the last order number of the ballot is dropped.
        Parameters:
        tieCandidateList - List of candidates which are tied.

      • implementVoting

        public void implementVoting​()
        Implement voting algorithm (STV type) on the election (information loaded through the input file). First loads all the candidates that are running in the election from the input file. Then it load all the ballots cast in the election from the input file. Then it iterates through all the ballots and aggregating the respective ballots' vote to the particular candidate it is assigned to in order of preferences. After the function processes all the ballots it determines the candidate to be dropped in each iteration and if possible a winner(s) candidate(s). These iterations are repeated until the number of seats that need to be filled are filled with the winner candidates.

      • printElectionResults

        private void printElectionResults​()
        Print the election results to the standard output (Terminal).

      • writeBallotReport

        private void writeBallotReport​(STVBallot ballot,
                               STVCandidate candidate)
        Adds the content to reportcontent member variable about particular ballot that was assigned to a candidate in the voting.
        Parameters:
        candidate - The candidate to which the ballot was assigned.
        ballot - The current ballot for which the information needs to be added.

      • writeWinnerCandidateReport

        private void writeWinnerCandidateReport​(STVCandidate winnerCandidate)
        Adds the content to reportcontent member variable about particular candidate that was declared as a winner.
        Parameters:
        winnerCandidate - The candidate which was declared winner.

      • writeDroppedCandidateReport

        private void writeDroppedCandidateReport​(STVCandidate droppedCandidate)
        Adds the content to reportcontent member variable about particular candidate that was declared as a dropped candidate.
        Parameters:
        droppedCandidate - The candidate which was declared dropped.

      • writeReportToFile

        private void writeReportToFile​()
        Function responsible to write all the data of the report to an output file.
